intro: Blepharis calcitrapa var. decaryi, commonly known as the Decary's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This variety is noted for its adaptability to harsh conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
